hopobject.body:
Trade Show FAQs regarding BeagleBoard.org

Where do I find answers to frequently asked questions?

While beagleboard.org is the canonical source for information regarding the Foundation, the eLinux wiki is intended to be the canonical resource for the community to collaborate on frequently asked questions:

  • elinux.org/Beagleboard:BeagleBone_Black_FAQ

What is BeagleBoard.org and what makes that interesting?

  • BeagleBoard.org is a non-profit corporation
  • seeking to improve access to programming and electronics,
  • especially through open source collaboration.

What are you showing off at the booth today?

Where can you buy BeagleBone Black?

What is the relationship between BeagleBoard.org and Texas Instruments, and why is TI at the BeagleBoard.org booth?

What is the relationship between BeagleBoard.org and Element14, and why is Element14 at the BeagleBoard.org booth?

How is BeagleBoard.org and BeagleBoard.org products like BeagleBone Black different than Raspberry Pi or Arduino and their products?

Is BeagleBoard.org really open?
  • We try to be part of the solution and not the problem.

What is next for BeagleBoard.org?

When is BeagleBoard-X15 going to release?

Does BeagleBone Black support WiFi?

Does BeagleBone Black support video?

How do the give-aways work?

What are the rules for display of demos?

  • Business cards and flyers should be placed X.
